query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
1 Al tornar de la mente, che si chiuse 2 dinanzi a la pietà d’i due cognati, 3 che di trestizia tutto mi confuse,
4 novi tormenti e novi tormentati 5 mi veggio intorno, come ch’io mi mova 6 e ch’io mi volga, e come che io guati.
query.result:
**English:**
1 When my mind returned to me, which had been closed 2 before the pity of the two relatives, 3 which had confused me all with sadness,
4 new torments and new tormented people 5 I see around me, no matter how I move 6 and how I turn, and no matter where I look.
**Sanskrit:**
1 Yada manaḥ punar āgacchat, yat pūrvam āsi, 2 ubhayayoḥ svajanayoḥ dayayāpūrvam, 3 yābhyām aham viṣādamayah sarvataḥ sammūḍho 'bhavam,
4 nava piḍāḥ navaśca piḍitāḥ 5 paśyāmi paritas tasya, yathā aham carāmi 6 yathā aham parivartayāmi, yathā aham avalokayāmi.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
7 Io sono al terzo cerchio, de la piova 8 etterna, maladetta, fredda e greve; 9 regola e qualità mai non l’è nova.
query.result:
**English:**
7 I am in the third circle, of the rain 8 eternal, cursed, cold, and heavy; 9 rule and quality are never new to it.
**Sanskrit:**
7 Tṛtīye 'ham aśanau, vṛṣṭeḥ 8 nityāyāḥ, śaptāyāḥ, śītasyāḥ, guruṇyāśca; 9 niyamaḥ guṇaśca na kadācit tasya navau.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
10 Grandine grossa, acqua tinta e neve 11 per l’aere tenebroso si riversa; 12 pute la terra che questo riceve.
query.result:
**English:**
10 Large hail, dark water, and snow 11 pour down through the darkened air; 12 the earth stinks as it receives this.
**Sanskrit:**
10 Mahāśilā, kṛṣṇodakaṃ, himaṃ ca 11 Nabhastalāt tamaḥpūrṇāt niṣyandate; 12 Durgandham bhūmiḥ pratigṛhṇāti.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
13 Cerbero, fiera crudele e diversa, 14 con tre gole caninamente latra 15 sovra la gente che quivi è sommersa.
query.result:
**English:**
13 Cerberus, a cruel and savage beast, 14 with three canine throats barks 15 over the people who are submerged here.
**Sanskrit:**
13 Cerberus, narakṛūraḥ viṣamaśca, 14 tribhiḥ śvākanṭhaiḥ latrati 15 janair ya iha nimagnaiḥ.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
16 Li occhi ha vermigli, la barba unta e atra, 17 e ’l ventre largo, e unghiate le mani; 18 graffia li spirti ed iscoia ed isquatra.
query.result:
**English:**
16 His eyes are red, his beard greasy and black, 17 his belly wide, and his hands clawed; 18 he scratches the spirits and flays and quarters them.
**Sanskrit:**
16 Netre tasya raktavarṇe, śmaśru tailamraktābhravarṇam ca, 17 Udaram ca vistīrṇam, nakhāś ca tasya tikshṇāḥ, 18 Ātmasāt kurute pretān, chindyati ca vināśayati ca.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
22 Quando ci scorse Cerbero, il gran vermo, 23 le bocche aperse e mostrocci le sanne; 24 non avea membro che tenesse fermo.
query.result:
**English:**
22 When Cerberus, the great worm, saw us, 23 he opened his mouths and showed us his tusks; 24 he had no limb that he kept still.
**Sanskrit:**
22 Yada naḥ apaśyat Cerberus, mahān kīṭaḥ, 23 Mukhāni vivṛṇoti sma, damṣṭrāś ca pradarśayati sma; 24 Na tasya aṅgam āsīt yaḥ sthiraḥ āsīt.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
25 E ’l duca mio distese le sue spanne, 26 prese la terra, e con piene le pugna 27 la gittò dentro a le bramose canne.
query.result:
**English:**
25 And my leader stretched out his hands, 26 took some earth, and with his fists full 27 threw it into the greedy reeds.
**Sanskrit:**
25 Eva ca mama netāḥ svakīrṇau hastau praसार्य, 26 pṛthivīṃ gṛhītvā, muṣṭibhyāṃ pūrṇābhyām, 27 tām tr̥ṣṇayuktāsu nalikeṣu akṣipat.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
28 Qual è quel cane ch’abbaiando agogna, 29 e si racqueta poi che ’l pasto morde, 30 ché solo a divorarlo intende e pugna,
31 cotai si fecer quelle facce lorde 32 de lo demonio Cerbero, che ’ntrona 33 l’anime sì, ch’esser vorrebber sorde.
query.result:
**English:**
28 Like a dog that barks with longing, 29 and then falls silent when he bites the food, 30 and only thinks of devouring and fighting it,
31 so did those filthy faces of 32 the demon Cerberus, who deafens 33 the souls so that they would like to be deaf.
**Sanskrit:**
28 Yathā sa śvā yaḥ abhibhāṣamāṇaḥ āśiṣati, 29 tataḥ tu śāntatām āgacchati yadā annam adatte, 30 yaḥ kevalam tad bhakṣaṇāya prayatate ca yudhyate ca,
31 Tathā eva abhavan tāḥ mukhamālāḥ 32 asurasya Cerberasya, yaḥ ākrāmati 33 jīvātmānaḥ, tathā yathā tāḥ badhirāḥ abhūt.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
34 Noi passavam su per l’ombre che adona 35 la greve pioggia, e ponavam le piante 36 sovra lor vanità che par persona.
query.result:
**English:**
34 We passed over the shades that the heavy 35 rain prostrates, and we set our feet 36 upon their nothingness that seems a person.
**Sanskrit:**
34 Vayam atīyāmāḥ chāyāḥ tāḥ yāḥ adhunā 35 guruḥ vṛṣṭiḥ patayati, ca adhāmaḥ sma 36 padau asmākam tāsu mithyātvam yāḥ puruṣaḥ iva pratibhāti.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
37 Elle giacean per terra tutte quante, 38 fuor d’una ch’a seder si levò, ratto 39 ch’ella ci vide passarsi davante.
query.result:
**English:**
37 They were all lying on the ground, 38 except for one who rose up to sit, quickly 39 when she saw us passing in front of her.
**Sanskrit:**
37 Tāḥ sarvāḥ bhūmau śayitāḥ āsīt, 38 ekāṃ vinā yā āsane upaviśat, kṣipram 39 yadā naḥ paśyati puras tasya gacchatas.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
40 «O tu che se’ per questo ’nferno tratto», 41 mi disse, «riconoscimi, se sai: 42 tu fosti, prima ch’io disfatto, fatto».
query.result:
**English:**
40 "O you who are brought to this hell," 41 he said to me, "recognize me, if you can: 42 you were created before I was undone."
**Sanskrit:**
40 "He bhagavan yaḥ tvam idam narakam āgataḥ asi," 41 sa āha, "jānīhi māṃ yadi śaknoși: 42 tvam āsīḥ, pūrvaṃ yataḥ aham vināśitaḥ, vinirmitaḥ."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
43 E io a lui: «L’angoscia che tu hai 44 forse ti tira fuor de la mia mente, 45 sì che non par ch’i’ ti vedessi mai.
query.result:
**English:**
43 And I to him: "The anguish that you have 44 perhaps draws you out of my mind, 45 so that it does not seem that I ever saw you.
**Sanskrit:**
43 Aham ca tasmai: "Śokaḥ yaḥ tava asti 44 sa mama manasaḥ tvām apiharati, 45 yataḥ na pratibhāti mama tvām pūrvam dṛṣṭavān aham."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
46 Ma dimmi chi tu se’ che ’n sì dolente 47 loco se’ messo, e hai sì fatta pena, 48 che, s’altra è maggio, nulla è sì spiacente».
query.result:
**English:**
46 But tell me, who are you who are placed in such 47 a sorrowful place, and have such pain, 48 that if there is another greater, none is so distressing.
**Sanskrit:**
46 Api tu mama bruhi kaḥ asi yaḥ evamrūpe 47 duḥkha-sthāne sthitaḥ asi, caivamrūpāṃ śokapīḍāṃ anubhavasi, 48 yadi anyāpi duḥkha-pīḍā asti, tadapi naivamrūpā duḥkha-pīḍā asti.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
49 Ed elli a me: «La tua città, ch’è piena 50 d’invidia sì che già trabocca il sacco, 51 seco mi tenne in la vita serena.
query.result:
**English:**
49 And he to me: "Your city, which is so full 50 of envy that the sack is already overflowing, 51 kept me with it in the serene life.
**Sanskrit:**
49 Sa ca mama: "Tava nagarī, yā pūrṇā 50 īrṣyayā yathā idānīm ādhānam atiriktam asti, 51 mayā saha sthitā āsīt śānte jīvite.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
52 Voi cittadini mi chiamaste Ciacco: 53 per la dannosa colpa de la gola, 54 come tu vedi, a la pioggia mi fiacco.
query.result:
**English:**
52 You citizens called me Ciacco: 53 for the harmful sin of gluttony, 54 as you see, I am weakened by the rain.
**Sanskrit:**
52 Yuṣmākaṃ nagaravāsinaḥ mama nāma Ciacco ācakṣate: 53 āhārakṣayasya pāpakasya doṣeṇa, 54 yathā tvam paśyasi, varṣeṇa aham klāmyāmi.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
55 E io anima trista non son sola, 56 ché tutte queste a simil pena stanno 57 per simil colpa». E più non fé parola.
query.result:
**English:**
55 And I, a sorrowful soul, am not alone, 56 for all these [other souls] are in similar pain 57 for a similar fault." And she said no more.
**Sanskrit:**
55 Ahaṃ ca durātmavān naikaḥ, 56 Sarvāṇi hy etāni tulyadandhaniyamāni, 57 Tulyāparādhāni. Na ca punaḥ kiṃcid abhāṣata.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
58 Io li rispuosi: «Ciacco, il tuo affanno 59 mi pesa sì, ch’a lagrimar mi ’nvita; 60 ma dimmi, se tu sai, a che verranno
61 li cittadin de la città partita; 62 s’alcun v’è giusto; e dimmi la cagione 63 per che l’ha tanta discordia assalita».
query.result:
**English:**
58 I answered him: "Ciacco, your suffering 59 weighs on me so much that it moves me to tears; 60 but tell me, if you know, what will become
61 of the citizens of the divided city; 62 is there any just man among them; and tell me the reason 63 why such discord has assailed it".
**Sanskrit:**
58 Aham enam pratyavādam cakāra: "Cyāko, tava duḥkham 59 mama tāvad bhavati yena aśru-pātam ānayati; 60 kim tu mama vaktavyam, yadi tvam vetsi, kim bhavitavyam
61 vihīnāyāḥ nagaryāḥ nagara-vāsinaḥ; 62 kim asti tatra ko'pi dharmātmaḥ; mama ca vaktavyam kāraṇam 63 yena tāvatī virodhitā tena ākrāntā".

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
64 E quelli a me: «Dopo lunga tencione 65 verranno al sangue, e la parte selvaggia 66 caccerà l’altra con molta offensione.
query.result:
**English:**
64 And those to me: "After a long contention 65 they will come to blood, and the savage party 66 will chase the other with much harm.
**Sanskrit:**
64 Te ca mama: "Dīrghaṃ vicāraṇānantaram 65 Raktaṃ prāpsyataḥ, tatra ca anāgārikāḥ 66 Aparān bahuṃ himsṛtya nirasyanti."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
67 Poi appresso convien che questa caggia 68 infra tre soli, e che l’altra sormonti 69 con la forza di tal che testé piaggia.
query.result:
**English:**
67 Then it is necessary that this one fall 68 within three suns, and that the other rise 69 with the force of one who is now on the shore.
**Sanskrit:**
67 Tataścaivaivamavasyamidaṃpatati 68 tribhiḥeva sūryaiḥ, anyaccaiva udeti 69 tasya balena yaḥ adhunā tīre vartate.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
70 Alte terrà lungo tempo le fronti, 71 tenendo l’altra sotto gravi pesi, 72 come che di ciò pianga o che n’aonti.
query.result:
**English:**
70 They held their foreheads bowed to the ground for a long time, 71 bearing the other [heads] as heavy weights, 72 so that they weep and groan about it.
**Sanskrit:**
70 Cirakālam śiraḥsi nihitāni bibhratā, 71 anyāni śiraḥsi guru-bhāra-vat, 72 yataḥ tadartham rudanti ca vilāpanti ca.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
73 Giusti son due, e non vi sono intesi; 74 superbia, invidia e avarizia sono 75 le tre faville c’hanno i cuori accesi».
query.result:
**English:**
73 Two are just, and they are not heard; 74 pride, envy, and avarice are 75 the three sparks that have set hearts aflame.
**Sanskrit:**
73 Dve ca nyāye, na ca śṛṇyate tau; 74 madaḥ, īrṣyā, lobhaś ca, 75 trayas tan-niśitāgni-viṣphuliṅgāni hṛdayāni dadhauḥ.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
76 Qui puose fine al lagrimabil suono. 77 E io a lui: «Ancor vo’ che mi ’nsegni 78 e che di più parlar mi facci dono.
query.result:
**English:**
76 Here he put an end to the tearful sound. 77 And I to him: "I still want you to teach me 78 and that you grant me the gift of more speech.
**Sanskrit:**
76 Atra aśrujanakasya śabdasya antaḥ akārṣīt. 77 Ahaṃ ca tasmai: "Adyāpi tvām icchāmi yathā mama upadeśaṃ kuru 78 tathā ca adhikaṃ kathanaṃ mama nimittaṃ kuru.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
79 Farinata e ’l Tegghiaio, che fuor sì degni, 80 Iacopo Rusticucci, Arrigo e ’l Mosca 81 e li altri ch’a ben far puoser li ’ngegni,
82 dimmi ove sono e fa ch’io li conosca; 83 ché gran disio mi stringe di savere 84 se ’l ciel li addolcia o lo ’nferno li attosca».
query.result:
**English:**
79 Farinata and Tegghiaio, who were so worthy, 80 Jacopo Rusticucci, Arrigo and Mosca, 81 and the others who applied their minds to doing good,
82 tell me where they are and let me know them; 83 for a great desire constrains me to know 84 if Heaven sweetens them or Hell embitters them.
**Sanskrit:**
79 Farinātaḥ ca Tegghiaiaḥ ca ye bāhyataḥ evaṃ śobhanīyāḥ āsīt, 80 Iacopaḥ Rusticucciḥ, Arrigaḥ ca Moscaḥ ca 81 anye ca ye śubhānāṃ karmaṇām kurvaṇe buddhīḥ prayuktāḥ āsīt,
82 mama vakṣva kutaḥ santi, kuru ca yathā aham tān jānīyām; 83 kathaṃ hi mama jñātum icchā mahān āviṣṭā asti 84 kim svargaḥ tān madhurīkaroti uta narakaḥ tān kaṭukīkaroti.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
85 E quelli: «Ei son tra l’anime più nere; 86 diverse colpe giù li grava al fondo: 87 se tanto scendi, là i potrai vedere.
query.result:
**English:**
85 And those: "They are among the blackest souls; 86 various sins weigh them down to the bottom: 87 if you descend so far, you will be able to see them there.
**Sanskrit:**
85 Te ca: "Teṣāṃ madhye niṣṭhatamāḥ puruṣāḥ santi; 86 nānāvidhāni pāpāni adhastāt tāṃs tiṣṭhanti: 87 yadi tāvatīṃ dūratāṃ gamiṣyasi, tatra tāṃs drakṣyasi.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
88 Ma quando tu sarai nel dolce mondo, 89 priegoti ch’a la mente altrui mi rechi: 90 più non ti dico e più non ti rispondo».
query.result:
**English:**
88 But when you are in the sweet world, 89 I beg you to bring me to the minds of others: 90 I say no more to you and answer you no more."
**Sanskrit:**
88 Api tu yadā tvam madhure loke bhaviṣyasi, 89 prārthayāmi tvām yathā mama smaraṇam anyeṣām manasi kārayeḥ: 90 adhikaṃ na bruve, adhikaṃ na pratipadyāmi.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
91 Li diritti occhi torse allora in biechi; 92 guardommi un poco e poi chinò la testa: 93 cadde con essa a par de li altri ciechi.

Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
94 E ’l duca disse a me: «Più non si desta 95 di qua dal suon de l’angelica tromba, 96 quando verrà la nimica podesta:
97 ciascun rivederà la trista tomba, 98 ripiglierà sua carne e sua figura, 99 udirà quel ch’in etterno rimbomba».
query.result:
**English:**
94 And the leader said to me: "No one awakens 95 from here until the sound of the angelic trumpet, 96 when the enemy power will come:
97 each one will see again the sad tomb, 98 will take back his flesh and his form, 99 will hear that which resounds eternally."
**Sanskrit:**
94 Evaṃ ca nāyakaḥ mama abravīt: "Atra śabdad aivataḥ 95 na jāgarti ko'pi divyasya śaṅkhasya, 96 yadā āgacchati aśubhā śaktiḥ:
97 pratyekam paśyati punaḥ śokārtāṃ śayyām, 98 gṛhṇāti punaḥ svamāṃsam tathā rūpam, 99 śṛṇoti yat kiṃcid anante kāle ghoṣayati."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
106 Ed elli a me: «Ritorna a tua scïenza, 107 che vuol, quanto la cosa è più perfetta, 108 più senta il bene, e così la doglienza.
query.result:
**English:**
106 And he to me: "Return to your knowledge, 107 which wills that, the more perfect the thing is, 108 the more it feels pleasure, and thus pain."
**Sanskrit:**
106 Sa ca mama: "Pratyāgaccha tava jñānam prati, 107 yat icchati, yathāvastu satmyam adhikam, 108 adhikam anubhavati sukham, evam ca duḥkham."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
109 Tutto che questa gente maladetta 110 in vera perfezion già mai non vada, 111 di là più che di qua essere aspetta».
query.result:
**English:**
109 All of these evil people 110 will never reach true perfection, 111 and they expect to be worse off there than here.
**Sanskrit:**
109 Sarve ete pāpātmānaḥ 110 Satyaṃ sampūrṇatāṃ naiva prāpsyanti, 111 Atrataḥ adhikaṃ tatra bhavitum icchanti.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
112 Noi aggirammo a tondo quella strada, 113 parlando più assai ch’i’ non ridico; 114 venimmo al punto dove si digrada:
115 quivi trovammo Pluto, il gran nemico.
query.result:
**English:**
112 We circled around that road for a long time, 113 talking much more than I can tell; 114 we came to the point where it descends:
115 there we found Pluto, the great enemy.
**Sanskrit:**
112 Tām mārgaṃ cakriṣmaḥ paritaḥ ciraṃ kālam, 113 kathāyantaḥ adhikaṃ yataḥ na vakṣyāmi; 114 āgamiṣyāmaḥ tatra yatra avakrāmati:
115 tatra prāpnumaḥ Pluto, mahāntam śatrūm.
